and that the commander in chief would otherwise be dissatisfied. On hear- ing this the regimental commander hung his head, silently shrugged his shoulders, and spread out his arms with a choleric gesture. 
"A fine mess we've made of it!" he remarked. 
"There now! Didn't I tell you, Michael Mit- rich, that if it was said 'on the march' it meant in greatcoats?" said he reproachfully to the battalion commander. "Oh, my God!" he ladd- ed, stepping resolutely forward. "Company commanders! " he s
